title: Fintech Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A fintech benchmarks emphasize proven unit economics and sustainable growth. Investors compare against public fintech metrics and expect trajectory toward industry-leading economics. Growth efficiency matters more than raw growth rate. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Annual Recurring Revenue
metrics.note: ARR range for Series A fintech. Quality and sustainability matter as much as size.

metrics.label: Revenue Growth Rate
metrics.note: Year-over-year growth. Show alongside efficiency metrics—growth at reasonable burn.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Revenue minus cost of revenue. Varies by model—payments lower, lending variable, subscriptions higher.

metrics.label: Contribution Margin
metrics.note: After variable costs (processing, fraud, support). Path to 60%+ at scale.

metrics.label: CAC Payback Period
metrics.note: Months to recover acquisition cost. Under 12 is excellent for fintech.

metrics.label: LTV:CAC Ratio
metrics.note: Based on actual cohort behavior. Clear path to 5:1+ expected.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention
metrics.note: Revenue retention including expansion. Above 100% indicates product stickiness.

metrics.label: Logo Retention
metrics.note: Annual customer retention. Varies by segment—SMB lower, enterprise higher.

metrics.label: Fraud Rate
metrics.note: Fraud losses as percentage of volume. Improving trend expected.

metrics.label: Burn Multiple
metrics.note: Net burn divided by net new ARR. Measures capital efficiency of growth.
